snippet: Even as Prime Minister Mario Monti’s decision to resign rattled Milan’s stock market and worried European leaders, Italian centrists tried to persuade him to join their parties.
abstract: Italian Prime Min Mario Monti plays down speculation about whether he will run against former Prime Mim Silvio Berlusconi in upcoming elections, even as Italian centrists step up efforts to persuade him to join their political movements.
lead_paragraph: Even as Prime Minister Mario Monti’s decision to resign rattled Milan’s stock market and worried European leaders, Italian centrists tried to persuade him to join their parties.

headline.seo: Italy’s Monti Is Cool to Running on His Own
headline.main: Italy’s Premier Refuses to Commit to Running
headline.print_headline: Italy’s Premier Refuses To Commit to Running
